oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 18 b.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 18 b. Newspaper clipping: Statement by J.G. Lowe, Fountain City, TN. March 12, 1917.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Women's rights;
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: J.G. Lowe
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The man is interested in his children and, knowing their needs, should have a voice in making laws for their welfare and protection. The woman is interested in her children, and having a keener sense of their needs should have a voice in making laws for their welfare and protection. There is no argument for his right to vote that does not apply with equal propriety for her right to vote. J. G. LOWE, Mar. 12, 1917. Fountain City, Tenn.
